titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the R. E. Blair Collection of Western Oil and Mining Investment Prospectuses
Blair (R. E.) Collection of Western Oil and Mining Investment Prospectuses
titlestmt.author: by Jennifer Meehan

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Sunday December 9, 2018 at 04:42

did.unittitle: R. E. Blair collection of Western oil and mining investment prospectuses

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection consists of promotional material, including form letters, maps, reprints of newspaper articles, and publications, that describe oil and mining investment opportunities in various Western states, including Texas, Colorado, Arizona, Nevada, and New Mexico, during the time period of the Great Depression. The materials were sent to R. E. Blair as a prospective investor in oil and mining ventures.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Sindell and Company on the Thomas W. Streeter Fund, 2008.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The R. E. Blair Collection of Western Oil and Mining Investment Prospectuses is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: R. E. Blair Collection of Western Oil and Mining Investment Prospectuses. Yale Collection of Western Americana, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, and competing priorities. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections as they are acquired, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.

This collection received a medium level of processing in 2009. Processing included removing items from plastic enclosures, rehousing items in acid-free folders and boxes, organizing material into groups according to geographical location, and then organizing material within geographical groupings alphabetically by business name based on the letterhead. Information included in the Description of Papers note and Collection Contents section is drawn from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles were largely supplied by staff during processing.

bioghist.head: R. E. Blair
bioghist.p: R. E. Blair was a resident of Keene, New Hampshire during the late 1920s to the early 1940s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of promotional material, including form letters, maps, reprints of newspaper articles, and publications, that describe oil and mining investment opportunities in various Western states, including Texas, Colorado, Arizona, Nevada, and New Mexico, during the time period of the Great Depression. The materials were sent to R. E. Blair as a prospective investor in oil and mining ventures.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into four series: I. Texas Oil Investments,1928-1941. II. Colorado Oil and Mining Investments, 1928-1940. III. Oil and Mining Investments in Other States and Mexico, 1928-1941. IV. Other Investment Material, 1929-1941.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series consists of prospectus material for oil investment opportunities in Texas or with Texas-based companies. Specific geographical areas in Texas include Blanco County, Callahan County, Cooke County, Howard County, Jones County, LaSalle County, Mills County, Pecos County, and Shackelford County, among others. Also found is some prospectus material for other types of investments, such as the Bayou Chane salt dome.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged into two subseries: Oil Investments and Mining Investments. Material within subseries arranged alpabetically by business name.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series consists of prospectus material for oil and mining investment opportunities in Colorado or with Colorado-based companies.

did.unittitle: Golden Gilpin Ore Reduction & Refining Company
Oil and Mining Investments in Other States and Mexico

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by state, and then alphabetically by business name.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series consists of prospectus material for oil and mining investment opportunities in various states and in Mexico.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series consists of various financial and investment-related publications and subscription offers.
